data.approach: Research how LLM API calls are made in the IDE - check if we use subscription-based auth via LLMService or direct API keys, then advise on README.md changes

data.taskTitle: do we still need api keys in the readme.md
summary: Researched how LLM calls work in the IDE via llmService.ts
API keys are still useful but NOT required due to Claude CLI fallback
Documentation is mostly accurate but could be updated to reflect the fallback system
findings: llmService.ts provides auto/api/cli modes with automatic fallback
Claude CLI uses existing subscription auth - no API key needed
API key gives direct API access (faster, no subprocess overhead)
Without API key, all AI features still work via Claude CLI fallback

suggestedTasks.title: Update README with current authentication method details
suggestedTasks.description: Modify readme.md to remove outdated API key references and explain the new subscription-based authentication mechanism for LLM service. Clarify how developers should set up and use the new authentication approach. Include any configuration steps or environment variables required.
suggestedTasks.reason: Current documentation may be misleading with old API key instructions

suggestedTasks.title: Document LLM service subscription configuration process
suggestedTasks.description: Create a detailed guide explaining how to set up and configure the LLM service subscription. suggestedTasks.reason: Lack of clear documentation about new authentication mechanism

patterns: Moving from static API keys to dynamic subscription-based authentication
gotchas: Ensure no sensitive credentials are accidentally committed
